pullRequest.title: Refactor WebServer and split behaviour into handlers
pullRequest.bodyText:
This introduces a RequestHandler interface, where implementations are injected into a set of handlers and processed into a sorted list by the WebServer, and then applied to its router as before. Each of these new handlers extracts existing logic and behaviour from the WebServer, as well as moving any relevant tests. No functional changes are made, which has been verified by running the integration tests in #164 against these changes as well as with manual testing. This makes the WebServer significantly smaller and simpler, so that the individual RequestHandlers can be unit tested much more easily and the WebServer itself does not have as many direct responsibilities.
Still in progress: handle CORS using these new handlers.
There are some TODOs left behind or newly added, which are intended to be addressed in a later cleanup. Some of them also require supporting changes in -core. There is also opportunity for more tests to be added, before and particularly after these cleanups are done.

afterCommit.message: Log name of disabled request handlers

commit.message:
Add injected RequestHandlers and module

RequestHandlers interface defines a handler for HTTP requests for
modular, pluggable Vertx request handlers. These can be provided by the
new RequestHandlersModule and injected into the WebServer to extend its
functionality.
Reimplement recording download paths as RequestHandlers
Reimplement report download paths as RequestHandlers

Reimplement POST /api/v1/recordings as RequestHandlers

Also implement RequestHandler priorities, allowing multiple handlers to
be defined for the same method+route while also allowing predictable
handler ordering.
Reimplement web-client assets serving as RequestHandler
RequestHandlers default to async, and if not, default to ordered execution
If route unavailable, disable rather than not registering
Use router order for ensuring handler ordering

Support RequestHandlers applied to all paths

Allows RequestHandler to receive all requests and handle appropriately
